RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Ingresso no curso de Engenharia Civil da Universidade Federal do Cear (UFC) em 2007 aos dezesseis anos, interessou-se por pesquisa cientfica ainda no primeiro ano de faculdade. Foi bolsista do Programa de Educao Tutorial da Secretaria de Ensino Superior (SESu-MEC) durante o primeiro semestre de 2008, quando teve suas primeiras publicaes na rea de materiais para pavimentao. Foi bolsista de iniciao cientfica PIBIC/CNPq durante trs anos e meio da faculdade de Engenharia Civil e teve 20 meses de experincia no exterior, incluindo dois estgios na rea de Pavimentao, um cientfico (LCPC, Frana) e um prtico (Eurovia, Frana), tendo sido bolsista Erasmus Mundus no programa EUBRANEX de cooperao entre a Unio Europia e o Brasil. diplomado com um mestrado europeu (Master) em Engenharia Civil pela cole Centrale de Nantes (ECN). tambm diplomado com um mestrado em Engenharia de Transportes pela UFC (realizado em 15 meses, tendo sido o primeiro do Petran escrito e defendido em ingls, com participante internacional na banca de defesa, Prof. Richard Kim da NCSU, EUA). Desenvolveu pesquisa de doutorado entre Julho de 2014 e Setembro de 2017 na cole Nationale des Travaux Publics de l'tat da Universidade de Lyon (ENTPE/Univ. Lyon), tendo sido bolsista do Programa Cincia sem Fronteiras (CsF) na categoria Doutorado Pleno. A tese concentrada em reologia (tanto modelagem quanto tcnicas experimentais) de materiais betuminosos em diferentes escalas. Foram estudados efeitos reversveis (auto-aquecimento por dissipao viscosa em material viscoelstico, no linearidade fsica e tixotropia) ao longo de ensaios cclicos em materiais betuminosos, que prejudicam a interpretao de ensaios de fadiga, utilizados para o dimensionamento de pavimentos asflticos. desde julho de 2018 Professor Adjunto-A do Departamento de Engenharia Estrutural e Construo Civil da Universidade Federal do Cear (DEECC/UFC) e Docente Permanente do Programa de Mestrado em Engenharia Civil (PEC/UFC). Realiza pesquisa em materiais betuminosos e em materiais cimentcios, notadamente em caracterizao reolgica, participando em diferentes projetos de pesquisa com empresas como Petrobras e EDP, entre outras.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Engenharia Civil from Universidade Federal do Cear (2012), master's at Master Gnie Civil from Ecole Centrale de Nantes (2010), master's at Transports Engineering from Universidade Federal do Cear (2014) and doctorate at Doctorat MEGA from Ecole Nationale des Travaux Publics de le Etat (2017). , acting on the following subjects: complex modulus, aging, asphalt mixtures, stiffness decrease and local self-heating.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Projeto "PC 02 - Definio de metodologias de dosagem e ensaio de misturas asflticas e da viabilidade do emprego de rejeitos ambientais como materiais para pavimentao", desenvolvido no Laboratrio de Mecnica dos Pavimentos da Universidade Federal do Cear (LMP/UFC), sob orientao do Prof. Jorge Barbosa Soares.

Projeto "Anlise da correlao entre as variveis de densificao e a deformao permanente em misturas asflticas convencionais e com utilizao de resduos", desenvolvido no Laboratrio de Mecnica dos Pavimentos da Universidade Federal do Cear (LMP/UFC), sob orientao do Prof. Jorge Barbosa Soares.

Projeto "Aplicao do modelo viscoelstico linear para obteno de propriedades de misturas asflticas preparadas com diferente temperaturas de usinagem e compactao para anlise de pavimentos", desenvolvido no Laboratrio de Mecnica dos Pavimentos da Universidade Federal do Cear (LMP/UFC), sob orientao do Prof. Jorge Barbosa Soares.

Projeto "Estudo da rigidez e da vida de fadiga de misturas asflticas por diferentes mtodos de ensaio", desenvolvido no Laboratrio de Mecnica dos Pavimentos da Universidade Federal do Cear (LMP/UFC), sob orientao do Prof. Jorge Barbosa Soares.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Definio de metodologias de dosagem e ensaio de misturas asflticas e da viabilidade do emprego de rejeitos ambientais como materiais para pavimentao
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O estudo ora proposto busca uma definio mais clara da melhor metodologia de dosagem de misturas asflticas, ou seja, de qual metodologia de compactao em laboratrio simula melhor as condies das misturas em campo, tornando assim os resultados laboratoriais mais confiveis e realistas. Isto pode ser realizado por meio do estudo das principais metodologias de dosagem e compactao em laboratrio conhecidas.Outro aspecto a ser abordado no presente estudo relativo a reutilizao de resduos e subprodutos das indstrias nacionais na pavimentao, pois o uso destes como matria prima possibilita a reduo de uso de recursos naturais, a reduo de demanda de energia para sua extrao, a reduo de transporte dos mesmos e a reduo do volume disposto nos aterros sanitrios e industriais. O crescimento do volume gerado de resduos e dos custos para a correta disposio, assim como a conscientizao ecolgica da sociedade torna imprescindvel a pesquisa por reciclagem ou reuso destes materiais..

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Estagirio no laboratrio de estudos e controle de misturas asflticas. Concepo e dosagem de misturas de acordo com o guia do Laboratrio Central de Pontes e Pavimentos (LCPC - Frana). Ensaios Prensa a Cisalhamento Giratrio, Estabilidade de DURIEZ e deformao permanente em simulador de trfego.

Estgio desenvolvido principalmente na sede de Nantes do antigo Laboratoire Central des Ponts et Chausses (ex-LCPC e atual IFFSTAR - Institut franais des sciences et technologies des transports, de l'amnagement et des rseaux). Tema ligado caracterizao de ligantes asflticos e modelagem do comportamento viscoelstico de tais materiais a baixa temperatura, incluindo fissurao.

Bolsista CNPq de Dezembro a Janeiro e Bolsista CAPES/FUNCAP desde fevereiro.

Apoio disciplina de Materiais Betuminosos (cerca de 9h/aula ministradas).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: INSTITUTO NACIONAL DE CINCIA E TECNOLOGIA DE CARACTERIZAO DE MATERIAIS PARA INFRAESTRUTURA
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: o	O INSTITUTO NACIONAL DE CARACTERIZAO DE MATERIAIS PARA INFRAESTRUTURA tem sede na UFC e engloba um grupo de pesquisa da UFPE e outro da UFBA. Entre os INCTs existentes do CNPq, nenhum trata especificamente daquilo que considerado um dos principais gargalos da Engenharia Civil, ou seja, a infraestrutura do nosso pas, incluindo rodovias, ferrovias, metrs, VLTs e suas estaes, aeroportos, empreendimentos para gerao de energia (barragens, torres elicas, termoeltricas). A UFC, com o apoio de agncias de fomento, desenvolveu e consolidou um grupo de pesquisa que capitaneou durante 15 anos a REDE ASFALTO N/NE (1 colocada no ranking da FINEP por duas vezes entre as Redes CT-Petro), e vem ampliando a sua atuao para outras reas de Infraestrutura, com diversos novos projetos alavancados. Possui uma estrutura fsica e laboratorial estabelecida, ocupando um laboratrio com mais de 2000m2, construdo com recursos da parceria com a Petrobras e contrapartida da UFC e da FINEP. Possui recursos humanos qualificados nos diversos nveis, inclusive administrativo, vrias ps-graduaes associadas, alm de parcerias com universidades e centros de pesquisa no Brasil e no exterior. A excelncia internacional do grupo atestada por meio das publicaes e cooperaes internacionais, alm do fato de j haver formado professores para COPPE, Poli/USP, UFES, UnB e Institutos Federais, alm de ter abrigado postdocs que hoje lecionam na PUC-RJ, UFC, Johns Hopkins. O grupo organizou importantes eventos internacionais que j contaram com pesquisadores de 29 pases distintos, e tambm congressos nacionais importantes da comunidade tcnico-cientfica. Destaque-se ainda a insero do grupo junto ao segmento produtivo no setor de transportes e de energia, incluindo diversas aes de transferncia de tecnologia. Os grupos que integraram a proposta de criao do INCT possuem um histrico de parceria em Rede, e formam um tringulo representativo dos estados de maior potencial de crescimento na regio NE, alm de serem reconhecidas ncoras da regio na formação de recursos humanos especializados e redução de desequilíbrios regionais do desenvolvimento científico e tecnológico. O projeto foi aprovado no mrito, sendo o grupo oficialmente detentor do ?selo INCT?, ainda que no tenham sido disponibilizados recursos financeiros pelo CNPq.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Estudo experimental e terico da tixotropia em materiais betuminosos aplicados em pavimentao: ligantes asflticos, mstiques, MAFs e misturas completas.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
A presente proposta apresentada na forma de um projeto de pesquisa e descreve atividades a
serem executadas por um jovem doutor (candidato Lucas Babadopulos) no Laboratrio de Mecnica
dos Pavimentos da Universidade Federal do Cear (LMP/UFC), que integra o Programa de
Ps-graduao em Engenharia de Transportes (Petran/UFC). O projeto de pesquisa lida com o
comportamento termomecnico de materiais betuminosos, visando descrever o fenmeno de
tixotropia, capaz de produzir diminuies de rigidez ao longo de ensaios cclicos e recuperao de
rigidez ao longo de tempos de repouso. Esse fenmeno pode ser confundido com o dano e o healing
de materiais betuminosos, prejudicando a interpretao de resultados de ensaios de fadiga e o
ajuste de modelos de descrio deste fenmeno. Tais modelos so necessrios previso de vida
de fadiga de pavimentos asflticos. O projeto tem, portanto, impacto nos ensaios de laboratrio, na
escolha de materiais e na previso de fadiga por meio de mtodos mecansticos-empricos, se
encaixando bem na linha de pesquisa de Mecnica dos Pavimentos da rea de concentrao de
Infraestrutura de Transportes do Petran. A colaborao com o grupo de pesquisa em materiais
betuminosos da Universidade de Lyon/ENTPE, Frana, enriquece o projeto, j que o referido grupo 
referncia nas pesquisas sobre fenmenos reversveis em ensaios de fadiga. O ensaio que se deve
instalar no LMP/UFC no escopo do projeto foi inicialmente proposto pelo referido grupo. O
equipamento a ser adaptado para as prensas hidrulicas do LMP/UFC conhecido como Annular
Shear Rheometer (Remetro de Cisalhamento Anular - ASR) e o LMP dispe dos meios necessrios
para viabiliz-lo. O projeto possibilitar fixao, no Cear, de um jovem doutor com grande potencial,
j verificado por numerosas publicaes em peridicos internacionais alm de apresentaes em
congressos. A proposta se insere em rea estratgica do estado do Cear quando se observam os
diversos editais da FUNCAP, alm de reforar uma ps-graduao de alcance regional e em nvel de
excelncia compatvel com outras ps-graduaes similares do pas. Seu nvel de relevncia pode
ser visto pelas cartas de apoio da Petrobras e DNIT, por exemplo. O grupo que abrigar o candidato,
bem como seu coordenador e supervisor do estgio ps-doutoral, possui atuao reconhecida
internacionalmente na rea em questo, tendo inclusive aprovado o Instituto Nacional de Cincia e
Tecnologia em Caracterizao de Materiais para Infraestrutura (INCT-Infra, Chamada
INCT-MCTI/CNPq/CAPES/FAPs n16/2014). A presente proposta contribuir sobremaneira para o
contnuo desenvolvimento do Petran/UFC, do LMP/UFC e do INCT-Infra.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: DESENVOLVIMENTO DE TCNICAS AVANADAS PARA CARACTERIZAO DE MATERIAIS E AVALIAO DE PAVIMENTOS ASFLTICOS NO BRASIL, COM A UNIVERSIDADE FEDERAL DO CEAR
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O mtodo de dimensionamento de pavimentos asflticos nacional em desenvolvimento no mbito da Rede Temtica de Asfalto, numa parceria entre a Petrobras e diversas universidades, alm do DNIT, representa um avano importante para a pavimentao do nosso pas. Entretanto, assim como ocorreu em outros pases que implementaram mtodos mecansticos-empricos, melhoramentos contnuos so sistematicamente considerados, at porque caracterizaes de materiais mais modernas j encontram-se disponveis (estado da arte), porm ainda precisam de validao local (para serem transpostas para o estado da prtica). A presente proposta, alm de (i) ampliar a base de dados com o monitoramento de pistas experimentais, foca nos seguintes aspectos inovadores adicionais que contribuiro para elevar a qualidade e a confiabilidade do novo mtodo: (ii) deformao permanente do revestimento asfltico, uma vez que apenas critrios limites sero estabelecidos no mtodo neste momento, embora existam modelos de evoluo desta falha bem estabelecidos e que podem ser incorporados, desde que devidamente calibrados e validados; (iii) caracterizao reolgica em diferentes escalas (ligantes, misturas de agregados finos e misturas completas, alm do efeito dos agregados), uma vez que as propriedades em funo do tempo e temperatura so hoje determinadas em pesquisas nacionais, mas ainda no sero consideradas no mtodo neste momento, sendo que a relao entre as diferentes escalas tem o potencial de ajudar na previso do comportamento da mistura completa partir da caracterizao dos seus constituintes; (iv) tratamentos superficiais, que no foram sequer considerados no mtodo, e cujos avanos em procedimentos de dosagem em laboratrio e melhores prticas devem ser propostos para um melhoramento subsequente da metodologia com vistas a torna-la til tambm para vias de baixo volume de trfego. Sero ainda elaborados modelos, baseados em propriedades simples, para previso do Mdulo de Resilincia de camadas granulares; (v) avaliar em campo, por meio de trechos experimentais e simulao de trfego, as melhores solues de pavimento/tcnica de captao de energia.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Caracterizao reolgica de materiais betuminosos e cimentcios e desenvolvimento de experimentos com Annular Shear Rheometer (ASR)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
A proposta trata da caracterizao reolgica de fluidos no-newtonianos como comumente o caso de diversos materiais de construo. So exemplos os materiais betuminosos, que sofrem fenmenos parasitas ao longo de ensaios cclicos, e os materiais cimentcios, estudados com particular foco no projeto. Os avanos propostos tm potencial impacto nas tcnicas de caracterizao de materiais betuminosos quanto fadiga e a rigidez, e, no caso de materiais cimentcios, seriam teis no desenvolvimento de novos Concretos Especiais e argamassas, respeitando o comportamento no-newtoniano desses materiais que 
frequentemente negligenciado com a aplicao de ensaios empricos de caracterizao.

Processo 423160/2018-4
Chamada: MCTIC/CNPq no 28/2018 - Universal/Faixa A - At R R$ 30.000,00.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CHALENGES WITH RESPECT TO AEROGENERATORS` FOUNDATION IN COASTAL ZONES
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
- Project Introduction:

With the perspective of climatic and demographical issues, the development of cleaner and renewable energies is necessary to address environmental challenges. Public works should stimulate innovation in the construction of wind power plant sites and energy transport infrastructure, in collaboration with research centres and universities. This includes the structures needed for the production of wind power: the wind turbines (also called aerogenerators) and its foundations. The project is, then, inserted in item a of the Call for Projects 01/2019 by FUNCAP/INSA-Rouen.

This project is interested in the structural behaviour of aerogenerators? foundations in coastal zones (also called ?Land-Sea Continuum?). It includes the behaviour of the concrete foundation structure itself and the soils behaviour, as well as their interaction. The project regroups principal teams in laboratories from the state of Cear in Brazil and from the region of Normandy in France, with orbital teams also in Cear and in the region Auvergne-Rhne-Alpes in France. At the French side, the team from Institut National des Sciences Appliques de Rouen (INSA-Rouen) leads the project with orbital teams from Universit Le Havre Normandie, Ecole Suprieure des Ingnieurs des Travaux et de la Construction de Caen (ESITC-Caen), Centre d'Etudes et d'Expertise sur les Risques, l'Environnement, la Mobilit et l'Amnagement (CEREMA Normandie Centre) and Laboratory of Tribology and Dynamics of Systems (LTDS) at University of Lyon/ENTPE and at Ecole Nationale d?Ingnieurs de Saint Etienne (ENISE). At the Brazilian side, a team from the National Science and Technology Institute for the Characterization of Materials for Infrastructure (INCT-Infra) leads the group that is also composed by a team from the Laboratory of Building Materials (LMCC) and the Laboratory of Computer Systems Engineering (LESC), all three from the Federal University of Cear at Fortaleza (UFC), and also the Group of Atmospheric Research from the State University of Cear (UECE).

The groups in France have been working with focus in the behaviour of soils foundations, particularly with respect to wind turbine foundations, while the groups in Fortaleza can be divided into two parts: INCT-Infra and LMCC are focused in the characterisation of materials and structures, mainly for building engineering and infrastructure, while the remaining groups have expertise on sensors network and can also contribute with climate input (which affects the behaviour of structures). This project brings these groups together to address a problem that is of particular importance to the region of Normandy and to the state of Cear due to their own geography and potential for wind power generation. The focus is on the structural behaviour of the foundation, from the construction to the service life of the aerogenerator.

- Objectives:

This project deals with the behaviour of wind turbine foundations in the Land-Sea Continuum and its associated pathologies. The specific objectives may be summarised and detailed in the 5 following points.

1-	To evaluate the response of wind turbine foundations in coastal zone, to identify associated pathologies, and in particular, to estimate the risk with respect to liquefaction phenomena during water level fluctuations.
2-	To take into account the spatial variability of the soil properties of foundations in the soil/structure interaction.
3-	To evaluate the properties of the concrete material of the foundations: fatigue, cracking, durability.
4-	To numerically model the soil-structure interactions under cyclic solicitation and to optimize the design of wind turbine foundations by instrumenting a real wind turbine site.
5-	To evaluate the use of instrumentations in wind turbine foundations for comparison of real experimental responses with models already developed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Thermomechanical Coupling in Bituminous Mixtures Considered as Bonded Granular Media

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: DE A. L. BABADOPULOS, LUCAS F.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
ABSTRACT

Bituminous mixtures can be seen as granular media composed by particles (larger aggregates) and a viscoelastic bonding phase (a mix of smaller aggregates and bitumen, called bituminous mastic). During fatigue experiments, a decrease in norm of complex modulus, increases in phase angle and in temperature are observed. This stiffness change is commonly misinterpreted as damage, supposedly irreversible. Literature proposed an explanation for that initial modulus decrease based on local thermal effects (local self-heating, creating a thermomechanical coupling), but considering no thermal diffusion. This work investigates thermal diffusion in the mastic phase. A non-uniform (local) heat production in the mastic is considered with simplified geometry (monodisperse rigid particles in a mastic phase). The local effects of temperature on stiffness were analyzed for the first 100 cycles of loading at 10Hz (10s). Results showed that the calculated modulus decrease is not sufficient to explain the changes during fatigue tests observed experimentally. That suggests the existence of another phenomenon (consistent with the definition of thixotropy) responsible for the reversible modulus decrease in bituminous mixtures.

Keywords: bituminous mixtures; thermomechanical coupling; self-heating; stiffness change.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract

The aggregate-asphalt binder adhesiveness is considerably affected by moisture. This property may accelerate distresses in asphalt pavement surface courses when aggregate-binder compatibility is not adequate. Numerous tests have been developed to measure this property, such as the Moisture-Induced Damage test (AASHTO T283) and the Asphalt Bond Strength test (AASTHO TP 91). The former measures the indirect tensile strength of dry and moisture-conditioned asphalt mixtures. The latter measures the tension stress needed to remove a pullout stub with asphalt binder from a solid substrate. Although these are distinct tests, both may be used as a means to analyze how moisture affects a certain combination of mineral aggregate and asphalt binder. The objective of this work is to correlate the results of these two tests and to analyze if the tested combinations of materials follow the same trend under both circumstances. Chemical compositions of the tested aggregates are also investigated. Results from Moisture-Induced Damage tests show that the use of an antistripping agent may reduce the impact of moisture-damage on tensile strength and that the aggregate with a higher content of calcium oxide performed better. The 12 h moisture conditioning in the Asphalt Bond Strength test had a strong correlation with the dry mixes, which was not noticed for the mixtures conditioned for 3 and 6 h. Asphalt mixture?s moisture sensitivity results correlated well to the loss of adhesion in the aggregate-binder interface.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Stress and strain dependence of bituminous materials viscoelastic properties

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the ISAP 2018 International Conference

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract

Bituminous materials are considered as linear viscoelastic for a small number of applied cycles at low strain amplitudes. Their behaviour can be represented considering the complex modulus and the complex Poisson?s ratio (isotropic case), which are obtained for sinusoidal loading. These two properties are independent of strain/stress amplitude in the case of linear viscoelasticity (LVE). However, when increasing amplitude, nonlinearity induces a strain dependence of the measured complex modulus. This paper investigates the phenomenon of nonlinearity in bitumen, mastic and bituminous mixture (BM). For bitumen and mastic, shear tests were performed on hollow cylinder specimens with the Annular Shear Rheometer (ASR) device, developed at University of Lyon/ENTPE. For BM, axial tension-compression tests on cylindrical specimens were carried out. Both tests are homogeneous and particularly adequate for nonlinearity investigation. Strain amplitude sweep (SAS) tests were performed at different temperatures and frequencies. Results show that BM presents non-negligible nonlinearity even for very small strain (few tens of μm/m). Nonlinearity effect?s intensity is temperature- and frequency- dependent. The LVE limit (strain at which 5% modulus decrease is obtained) decreases with temperature for BM and increases for bitumen and mastic. While mastic seems to inherit nonlinearity from bitumen, a secondary contribution from the granular skeleton may also play a role in BM nonlinearity.

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Accepted, proof already done, waiting to be published

Abstract

Bituminous materials are heterogeneous media composed of aggregate particles and bituminous
binder. The repetition of loading cycles on such materials induces stiffness changes. Those changes are measured during cyclic tension?compression tests by tracking the evolution of the norm and of the phase angle of the complex modulus. Different phenomena may be responsible for the stiffness changes. Some of those phenomena are completely reversible, for example, self-heating, recoverable nonlinearity (complex modulus dependency on stress/strain amplitude) and another bulk phenomenon, which is hypothesised as thixotropy. Another one, known as damage, is irreversible. All stiffness change in bituminous materials is frequently considered as caused by damage. This is not realistic, as careful analysis shows that the other phenomena are responsible for a major part of the stiffness decrease in most fatigue tests. Local self-heating could be a physical explanation for a large part of the observed reversible stiffness decrease. This paper proposes three simplified coupled thermomechanical analytical calculations in order to model the observed stiffness decrease due to local self-heating. The last calculation considers a heterogeneous structure of bituminous mixtures, composed of rigid monodisperse spherical particles and a mastic phase. The model allows calculating the initial slopes of the curves? ?norm of complex modulus? and ?phase angle? versus ?number of cycles?. Aggregate gradation of the mixture, mastic film thickness, volume fraction of binder and thermophysical properties of aggregate particles and binder are taken into account. Simulated and experimental results for one bituminous mixture were compared for tests at different temperatures and frequencies. Results show that local effects could explain the observed initial decrease in the norm of complex modulus during cyclic tests.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Nonlinearity of bituminous mixtures

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract

This paper presents an experimental characterisation of the strain dependency of complex modulus of bituminous mixtures for strain amplitude levels lower than about 110m/m. A series of strain amplitude sweep tests are performed at different temperatures (8, 10, 12 and 14C) and frequencies (0.3, 1, 3 and 10Hz), during which complex modulus is monitored. For each combination of temperature and frequency, four maximum strain amplitudes are targeted (50, 75, 100 and 110m/m). For each of them, two series of 50 loading cycles are applied, respectively at decreasing and increasing strain amplitudes. Before each decreasing strain sweep and after each increasing strain sweep, 5 cycles are performed at constant maximum targeted strain amplitude. 
Experimental results show that the behaviour of the studied material is strain dependent. Norm of complex modulus decreases and phase angle increases with strain amplitude. Results are presented in Black and Cole-Cole plots, where characteristic directions of nonlinearity can be identified. Both the effect of nonlinearity in terms of complex modulus variation and the direction of nonlinearity in Black space seem to validate the time-temperature superposition principle with the same shift factors as for linear viscoelasticity.
The comparison between results obtained during increasing and decreasing strain sweeps suggests the existence of another phenomenon occurring during cyclic loading, which appears to systematically induce a decrease of the norm of complex modulus and an increase of the phase angle, regardless of the type of the strain sweep (increasing or decreasing).

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Accepted, proof already done, waiting to be published

Abstract

Some researchers have used the fine aggregates matrix (FAM) as a means to evaluate the influence of material properties on the expected changes in the performance of hot mix asphalt (HMA). Based on the most commonly used definition, the FAM is composed of part of the fine aggregates (smaller than 1.18mm), mineral filler and asphalt binder. Different studies have used different methods to design such FAM mixes. In this study, the fatigue characteristics of different FAM designs (by varying their maximum aggregate size and binder content) were evaluated and compared to the fatigue characteristics of a corresponding full asphalt mixture. The goal of this exercise was to identify a FAM design that was most similar to the full asphalt mixtures in terms of its damage characteristics. The viscoelastic continuum damage approach was used to make such comparisons. Results show that FAM mixes with a maximum nominal aggregate size (MNS) of 2.00mm have similar damage evolution trends as that of the full hot mix asphalt with a maximum aggregate size of 12.50mm. Also, through the results and using a failure criterion based on energy, cyclic tests can be simulated at different loading conditions in order to construct Whler curves. The results showed that smaller MNS mixtures present better damage performance for strain levels lower than 500μstrain.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Relationship between multiple stress creep recovery (MSCR) binder test results and asphalt concrete rutting resistance in Brazilian roadways
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Relationship between multiple stress creep recovery (MSCR) binder test results and asphalt concrete rutting resistance in Brazilian roadways

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Accepted, waiting for proof, waiting to be published

Abstract

The selection of an asphalt binder that resists permanent deformation is a challenge, particularly to relate such resistance to the corresponding asphalt mixture behavior in the field. The main goal of this paper is to evaluate the relationship between asphalt binders? rutting resistance obtained in the laboratory with field observations of mixtures containing those binders. The performances of three monitored test sections were evaluated in Brazil. The rutting resistance of the asphalt mixtures was evaluated in laboratory by the Uniaxial Repeated Load and by the Triaxial Stress Sweep (TSS) tests. The corresponding asphalt binders were tested for the Performance Grade (PG), as well as for the percentage of recovery (R) and the non-recoverable compliances (Jnr) through the Multiple Stress Creep and Recovery (MSCR) test. Rutting performance prediction was conducted using Layered ViscoElastic analysis for Critical Distresses (LVECD) and TSS test results. The results pointed out that the characterization of the asphalt binders by itself is not sufficient to estimate the rutting behavior of the corresponding asphalt mixtures, because of the important role of the aggregates. Nevertheless, poor results in MSCR binder tests tend to indicate mixtures with poor performance (field and laboratory), i.e., the binder test can be used to avoid selecting binders that may lead to permanent deformation.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Application of the theory of viscoelasticity to evaluate the resilient modulus test in asphalt mixes

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Accepted with minor revisions (final version due for June 20th 2017)

Abstract

This paper deals with the analysis of indirect tensile resilient modulus (IT RM) tests for asphalt mixes. In Brazil, for instance, asphalt mix stiffness is deduced from a classical elastic analysis of that test, which may not be suitable for a viscoelastic material. A method is proposed to compare IT RM results obtained from classical experimental analysis and from tests simulated with viscoelastic models. Four different asphalt mixes (prepared using four different binders) were analyzed using IT RM tests with varying loading time and temperatures. Complex modulus (E*) tests were per-formed to characterize the linear viscoelastic behavior of the same materials on a wide range of temperature and fre-quency. 2S2P1D model and general Kelvin Voigt (GKV) model were then fitted on E* data. IT RM tests results were calculated using an analytical method and the viscoelastic GKV models obtained for the four mixes. Comparison shows that differences exist between results. Reasons for that, coming from particularities of the IT RM test are discussed. Finally, pavement analyses showed that such differences affect substantially the structural response.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Projeto e implementao de ensaio de fadiga por trao-compresso direta (uniaxial) para avaliao de dano em misturas asflticas

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BABADOPULOS, LUCAS FEITOSA DE ALBUQUERQUE LIMA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo 

No pas, so dois os mais recorrentes defeitos encontrados nas rodovias: deformao permanente e trincamento por fadiga. Dentre as mais variadas causas, a formao e propagao de trincas no revestimento asfltico ocorrem em consequncia das repetidas solicitaes do trfego que, com o tempo, reduziro drasticamente a vida de servio do pavimento, por exemplo, facilitando a penetrao de gua nas camadas granulares da estrutura e acelerando sua deteriorao. Alm disso, os ensaios mais comumente utilizados no Brasil para avaliao e previso de desempenho quanto fadiga do concreto asfltico ainda suscitam muitos questionamentos no meio tcnico-cientfico. Assim, no contexto da caracterizao avanada de misturas asflticas, realizou-se o desenvolvimento de projetos referentes a um sistema mecnico para ensaio bem como de tratamento de dados aps os testes. Trata-se do ensaio de Fadiga por Trao-Compresso Direta (Uniaxial) que possibilita avaliar e caracterizar o comportamento de misturas asflticas quanto ao dano por fadiga. Foram realizadas adaptaes de peas j existentes em outros dois centros de pesquisa para que se ajustassem prensa hidrulica utilizada na Universidade Federal de Santa Maria (UFSM): a Universal Testing Machine (UTM-25). Testes foram efetuados e monitorados para certificar a compatibilidade entre as peas produzidas e a prensa hidrulica utilizada e os resultados encontrados demonstraram sucesso no caminho proposto.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Fatigue cracking simulation of aged asphalt pavements using a viscoelastic continuum damage model

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: DE A. L. BABADOPULOS, LUCAS F.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract
Few information in the literature indicates how aging affects the service life of asphalt pavements. This work presents linear viscoelasticity and damage characterisation of an asphalt mixture at four aging states, and simulation of pavements fatigue performance. E* tests were performed in sinusoidal compression. Controlled crosshead tension-compression testing was used for damage characterisation. Aged materials were obtained by heating loose asphalt mixture at two temperatures (85C and 135C) and aging times (2 and 45 days). Two simulated pavements were studied for comparing behaviour at different ages using Layered Viscoelastic Pavement Analysis for Critical Distresses (LVECD). Results showed that the effect of aging seems to improve service life. It was also observed that simulating the asphalt layer as composed by two half-layers (aged at the top and unaged at the bottom) did not lead to significantly different results with respect to fatigue performance of an evenly aged layer.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A tool to design rutting resistant asphalt mixes through aggregate gradation selection

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
ABSTRACT

This work focuses on the proposition of a simple tool to evaluate the quality of the grain size distribution
and its potential to produce rutting resistant asphalt mixes. The tool is based on the hypothesis of the
existence of a main aggregate structure responsible for absorbing and transmitting stresses without
developing plastic deformation. Two parameters were proposed in this paper to characterize such a
structure: alpha and C ratios. The first characterizes the degree of interlocking of this structure, called the
Dominant Aggregate Size Range (DASR), while the latter is related to the amount of relatively bigger
particles within this structure. The Flow Number (FN) was adopted as an indicator of the rutting
resistance of 27 investigated asphalt mixes, varying in grain size distribution, aggregate origin, binder
type, and binder content. The proposed parameters alpha and C are established as characteristic parameters of the aggregate skeleton of the asphalt mix, and are well correlated with FN, indicating they have the potential for being useful tools. However, they do not capture the importance of the asphalt binder for the rutting resistance. A third index, kapa, is then established as a characteristic parameter of the asphalt mix associated with the rutting resistance. It is a combination of the gradation parameters (alpha and C), binder content and binder viscosity. An excellent correlation was observed between the FN and the kapa index. Finally, criteria for the j index were suggested as a function of traffic level, as it is conventionally done for FN values. Results from this work contribute to the development of rational tools to design resistant and stable aggregate gradation compositions for higher quality pavements.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Effect of aggregate shape properties and binder?s adhesiveness to aggregate on results of compression and tension/compression tests on hot mix asphalt

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract The mechanical behavior of hot mix asphalt is affected by their constituent properties,
i.e., aggregate and asphalt binder properties. The loading path used in laboratory testing is also a factor
that may influence results. The objective of this work was to investigate the effect of aggregate particle
shape properties and texture, as well as of the aggregate-binder adhesion, on different tests used to
evaluate mixture resistance: indirect tensile strength in axial compression (ITS); moisture-induced damage? modified Lottman; uniaxial repeated load permanent deformation?Flow number (FN); dynamic modulus,
both at compression and at tension/compression; and tension/compression fatigue life. The Aggregate Image Measurement System was used for analyzing aggregate particle shape properties. Asphalt Bond
Strength test results were used as an indicator of aggregate-binder adhesion. The results indicate that
the binder is relatively more important for tension/compression tests, while aggregate properties are relatively more important for compression tests. For the latter, the higher the load applied in the test, the
greater the importance of the aggregate to the mixture result, which is expected since this favors interlocking. ITS and FN results appear to be strongly affected by aggregate sphericity and texture. Dynamic modulus at compression depends more on aggregate shape properties, while fatigue life is more influenced by aggregate-binder adhesion.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Evaluation of Fatigue Behavior of Aged Asphalt Mixtures Using the Simplified Viscoelastic Continuum Damage Model

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 8th RILEM International Conference on Mechanisms of Cracking and Debonding in Pavements

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract

Aging of asphalt mixtures might play an important role in pavement structural behavior. That should be evaluated using mechanical models. This work aims at identifying the effects of aging on linear viscoelastic and damage behavior of asphalt mixtures, properties that influence the fatigue life of asphalt pavements. That is performed by characterizing a Hot Mix Asphalt (HMA) at four different aging states. The aged materials were obtained by heating loose asphalt mixture in oven at two different temperatures (85C and 135C) and aging times (2 and 45 days). Prony series were fitted to complex modulus results. For damage characterization, the Simplified Viscoelastic Continuum Damage (S-VECD) model was adopted. Damage characteristic curves and GR vs Nf failure envelopes were obtained from controlled crosshead tension-compression test results at 19C. It was concluded that aging produces materials that fail for less evolved damage states. However, depending on pavement conditions and layer geometry, and considering the HMA hardening, aging does not necessarily reduce the fatigue life.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Calculation of Stiffness Change Induced by Self-heating During Cyclic Loading of Bituminous Mixtures Considered as Heterogeneous Medium

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: ISAP Symposium "From Molecules to Innovative Pavements"

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract

Bituminous materials are heterogeneous media composed of aggregate particles and bituminous binder. A stiffness decrease occurs when applying repeated cyclic loading on such materials. That decrease is frequently misinterpreted as damage (an irreversible phenomenon) in the literature. Careful analysis shows that other phenomena do exist and are responsible for a major part of the stiffness decrease. Those are nonlinearity (complex modulus dependency on stress/strain amplitude), self-heating and another bulk reversible phenomenon, that is hypothesized as thixotropy. Local phenomena could also contribute to the observed stiffness decrease. This paper proposes a simplified coupled thermomechanical analytical calculation in order to model the observed stiffness decrease due to local self-heating. It considers a heterogeneous structure of bituminous mixtures and takes into account the local self-heating in the bituminous phase. The method allows predicting the initial slope of the curve ?norm of complex modulus? versus ?number of cycles?. The influences of the mastic film thickness, the volume fraction of binder and the thermophysical properties of aggregate particles and binder are taken into account by the model. Simulated and experimental results for bituminous mixtures were compared. Results show that local effects could explain, at least partially, the initial change in complex modulus during cyclic tests.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Local Self-Heating of Bituminous Mixtures at The Beginning of Cyclic Loading Tests

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: ISAP Workshop
DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: Road Materials and Pavement Design and LMP/UFC

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract

Bituminous mixtures are heterogeneous media composed of aggregate particles and bituminous binder. A stiffness decrease occurs when applying repeated cyclic loading on such materials. That decrease is frequently misinterpreted as damage (an irreversible phenomenon) in the literature, even for the very beginning of cyclic loading tests, where damage can be considered as negligible. Careful analysis shows that other phenomena do exist and are responsible for a major part of the stiffness decrease. Those are nonlinearity (complex modulus dependency on stress/strain amplitude), self-heating and another bulk reversible phenomenon, that is hypothesized as thixotropy. Local phenomena could contribute to the observed stiffness decrease, possibly presenting an explanation for thixotropy. This work presents calculations of initial modulus decrease occurring during cyclic loading in a bituminous mixture due to self-heating. Three cases, considering different sets of simplification hypotheses are analyzed. The first case considers homogeneous strain and heat distributions in the bituminous mixture. It may be valid if diffusion allows for a homogeneous temperature distribution in the whole material. Otherwise, it underestimates the potential for stiffness change in bituminous mixtures. The second one considers a homogeneous strain, but a heterogeneous heat distribution in the bituminous mixture (heat is concentrated only in the bitumen) and it results in a higher initial change in stiffness. In this case, diffusion allows for a homogeneous temperature distribution only in the bitumen, but it does not account yet for the existent non-homogeneous heat distribution within the mastic. The last one accounts for heterogeneous strain and heat distributions within the mastic. It consists in a simplified coupled heterogeneous thermomechanical calculation that models the stiffness decrease observed due to local self-heating.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Resistance to moisture-induced damage of asphalt mixtures and aggregate-binder interfaces

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: RILEM 252-CMB-Symposium

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract 

The aggregate-asphalt binder adhesiveness is considerably affected by moisture. This property may accelerate distresses in asphalt pavement surface courses when aggregate-binder compatibility is not adequate. Numerous tests have been developed to measure this property, such as the Moisture-Induced Damage test (AASTHO T283) and the Asphalt Bond Strength test (AASTHO TP 91). The former measures the indirect tensile strength of dry and moisture-conditioned as-phalt mixtures. The latter measures the tension stress needed to remove a pullout stub with asphalt binder from a solid substrate. Although these are distinct tests, both may be used as a means to analyze how moisture affects a certain combina-tion of mineral aggregate and asphalt binder. The objective of this work is to correlate the results of these two tests and to analyze if the tested combinations of materials follow the same trend under both circumstances. Chemical compositions of the tested aggregates are also investigated. Results from Moisture-Induced Damage tests show that the use of an antistripping agent may reduce the impact of moisture-damage on tensile strength and that the aggregate with a higher content of calcium oxide performed better. The 12 h moisture conditioning in the Asphalt Bond Strength test had a strong correlation with the dry mixes, which was not no-ticed for the mixtures conditioned for 3 and 6 h. Asphalt mixture?s moisture sensi-tivity results correlated well to the loss of adhesion in the aggregate-binder interface.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Stress and strain dependence of bituminous materials viscoelastic properties

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: ISAP 2018 International Conference

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Lucas Feitosa de Albuquerque Lima Babadopulos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Artigo selecionado entre os melhores do congresso para publicao estendida na revista Road Materials and Pavement Design (A1).

ABSTRACT

Bituminous materials are considered as linear viscoelastic for a small number of applied cycles at low strain amplitudes. Their behaviour can be represented considering the complex modulus and the complex Poisson?s ratio (isotropic case), which are obtained for sinusoidal loading. These two properties are independent of strain/stress amplitude in the case of linear viscoelasticity (LVE). However, when increasing amplitude, nonlinearity induces a strain dependence of the measured complex modulus. This paper investigates the phenomenon of nonlinearity in bitumen, mastic and bituminous mixture (BM). For bitumen and mastic, shear tests were performed on hollow cylinder specimens with the Annular Shear Rheometer (ASR) device, developed at University of Lyon/ENTPE. For BM, axial tension-compression tests on cylindrical specimens were carried out. Both tests are homogeneous and particularly adequate for nonlinearity investigation. Strain amplitude sweep (SAS) tests were performed at different temperatures and frequencies. Results show that BM presents non-negligible nonlinearity even for very small strain (few tens of μm/m). Nonlinearity effect?s intensity is temperature- and frequency- dependent. The LVE limit (strain at which 5% modulus decrease is obtained) decreases with temperature for BM and increases for bitumen and mastic. While mastic seems to inherit nonlinearity from bitumen, a secondary contribution from the granular skeleton may also play a role in BM nonlinearity.
